algorithm_technique: Calculate the range of visited sectors based on start and end points of rounds, considering circularity.
problem_summary_simple: Find the sectors visited most often during a marathon on a circular track.
problem_summary_technical: Determines the most visited sectors by analyzing the start and end points of each round, considering the circular nature of the track.
key_insights: The core idea is that only the sectors between the start of the first round and the end of the last round (inclusive, considering wrap-around) can be the most visited.
If the last round ends at or after the first round's start (circularly), all sectors in that range are visited equally.
If the last round ends before the first round's start (circularly), the sectors are split into two ranges: from start to end of track, and from start of track to end of round.
